critique: This document delegates authority from the President to the Secretary of State regarding regulations for executing and returning commissions by consular and diplomatic officers in criminal cases. It also revokes a previous executive order on the same topic. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism implications, national security vs. civil liberties concerns, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The delegation of authority could be seen as slightly restraining executive power, but it's a minor adjustment.
